emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Autonomous Coding Platforms
emerging_technologies.description: Platforms where AI not only assists but fully automates coding tasks, from design to deployment, with minimal human oversight.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to significant job displacement in software development but also increase productivity and reduce human error.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Initial resistance due to job security concerns; adoption will increase with proven reliability and regulatory frameworks.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural-Enhanced Reality
emerging_technologies.description: Augmented reality systems that adapt in real-time to user's cognitive state, enhancing learning, therapy, and immersive experiences.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances personalized learning and therapy but raises concerns over privacy and data protection.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Widespread adoption in educational and medical sectors, with slower consumer uptake due to cost and privacy concerns.

emerging_technologies.name: Space Resource Utilization
emerging_technologies.description: Technologies for extracting and processing resources on other celestial bodies, initially for use in space construction.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for new economic models, geopolitical tensions over space resources, and environmental considerations.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Dependent on successful space missions and regulatory agreements for space mining.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Digital Identity
emerging_technologies.description: A blockchain-based system where individuals control their personal data, providing identity verification without centralized databases.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances personal privacy but requires widespread adoption of blockchain and could face regulatory hurdles.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will be driven by privacy concerns and regulatory push for better data protection.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Assisted Software Development
mainstream_technologies.description: AI tools that not only complete code but also suggest optimizations, manage version control, and automate testing.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Highly adopted in tech industries, becoming standard in software development practices.

mainstream_technologies.name: Smart Autonomous Vehicles
mainstream_technologies.description: Vehicles that operate autonomously in controlled environments with full integration into urban infrastructure.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread in urban centers, with regulatory and safety frameworks in place to ensure widespread adoption.

epoch_themes.description: A shift towards systems and technologies that operate with minimal to no human intervention.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Job displacement, increased efficiency, and changes in urban planning and transportation.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased focus on AI ethics, regulatory frameworks for autonomous systems, and a rise in remote work.

epoch_themes.description: Technological solutions aimed at reducing environmental impact and managing resources sustainably.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes circular economy, reduces reliance on Earth's resources, and fosters interplanetary cooperation.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push towards green technologies, space law development, and sustainable development goals.
